channel.title: I need a ::Starter

item.title: I need a ::Starter
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Nope.
In client.java add
public static ArrayList starter = new ArrayList(server.playerHandler.maxPlayers);
Under public class client extends Player implements Runnable {

So it should look like

public class client extends Player implements Runnable {
public static ArrayList starter = new ArrayList(server.playerHandler.maxPlayers);

item.title: I need a ::Starter
item.dc:creator: @xXx_JAVA_OWNZ_U_xXx xXx JAVA OWNZ U xXx
item.description:
@xXx_JAVA_OWNZ_U_xXx wrote:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter")) {
	if (starter == 0) {
	    addItem(995, 5);
	    sendMessage("A message when used");
	    starter = 1;
	} else if (starter == 1) {
	    sendMessage("You have already received your starter pack");
	}
}

Read full topic

item.title: I need a ::Starter
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

ballin2005:

and is not working for ppl i put under my ::master command[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 21, 2007, 05:59:10 PM[/size][hr]why? y85

Ohk, how I would of done it.

Under your class declaration line (public class client implements etc) add this;

public static ArrayList<String> starter = new ArrayList<String>(server.playerHandler.maxPlayers);

then, this command.

else if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter")) { if(starter.contains(playerName)) { sendMessage("You've already gotten your pack to start."); } else { addItem(995, 100000); starter.add(playerName); sendMessage("Here you go."); } }

Don’t forget to add at the top of the file with all of the other import statements;
import java.util.ArrayList;
